entries.title: Israeli detention center faces legal challenge after ‘unimaginable abuses’
entries.description: Amid high-court scrutiny, hundreds of Gazan inmates were transferred out of Sde Teiman, a shadowy, military-run detention center in Israel’s southern desert.

entries.title: Israel to soon decide on Lebanon offensive as fighting with Hezbollah flares
entries.description: Three top Israeli officials warned an offensive at the Lebanon border could be imminent if the steady drumbeat of clashes with Hezbollah is not resolved.

entries.title: Here are the countries that recognize a Palestinian state
entries.description: Spain, Ireland, Norway and Slovenia are the latest to recognize a Palestinian state.

entries.title: India’s low-caste voters humbled its powerful prime minister
entries.description: Modi’s stunning setback in elections this week reflected the power of low-caste Hindus who rebelled against his ruling BJP.

entries.title: Gunman opens fire at U.S. Embassy in Lebanon and is shot by army
entries.description: The gunman, who has been hospitalized, was identified as a Syrian national. No motive for the attack has been reported yet.

entries.title: Biden, in France for D-Day anniversary, to stress contrast with Trump
entries.description: Biden’s D-Day visit will highlight the fight of democracy against authoritarianism, a reference to Donald Trump even if Biden does not explicitly name him.

entries.title: Tallest waterfall in China is fed by pipes, officials admit
entries.description: Yuntai Falls is considered China’s “tallest uninterrupted waterfall.” Officials admitted that its water is sourced from a pipe network during the drier months.

entries.title: King Charles III’s face arrives on Britain’s banknotes
entries.description: Most Britons have only ever had one monarch in their pockets.

entries.title: Here’s what to know about Modi and the Indian election
entries.description: Election results in India have not given Prime Minister Narendra Modi a predicted landslide majority. Here’s what to know about Modi and the election results so far.

entries.title: The war in Gaza looms over Asia’s geopolitics
entries.description: Western officials may have been unprepared for the depth of sympathies for Gaza among Asian countries — and their frustration over Western hypocrisy.

entries.title: Keir Starmer and Rishi Sunak clash in first U.K. election debate
entries.description: Sunak accused his challenger of not having big ideas. Starmer accused the prime minister of wanting to distance himself from the Conservative Party’s record.

entries.title: Biden announces new asylum cap in bid to deter illegal crossings
entries.description: President Biden announced a new plan to shut off access to the U.S. asylum system when illegal border crossings exceed a daily threshold.

entries.title: Biden ‘uncertain’ if Israel committing war crimes
entries.description: The U.S. leader’s remarks came as Israel signed an agreement with the United States for F-35 warplanes.

entries.title: Indian election delivers stunning setback to Modi and his party
entries.description: The BJP is still poised to form a government in coalition with allies. But this is the first time Modi has failed to win a majority over a 23-year political career.

entries.title: What to know about India’s election, the world’s biggest democratic event
entries.description: After 47 days of elections, Indians will get a new Parliament that the Bharatiya Janata Party is still expected to dominate.

entries.title: Why Mexico City’s thirst is causing it to sink
entries.description: The demand for water in Mexico’s capital is draining its underground aquifers — and fueling some of the fastest subsidence rates in the world.

entries.title: Netanyahu strains to keep government together amid spreading rebellions
entries.description: A string of standoffs, schisms and ultimatums have brought Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s emergency war cabinet to the brink of collapse.

entries.title: Netanyahu says no agreement yet on cease-fire proposal
entries.description: The Biden-led cease-fire proposal has divided public opinion in Israel, while Netanyahu and Hamas both say no agreement has yet been reached.
